intro: Erucaria hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy erucaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, typical of the mustard family. It is native to regions of southern Europe and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Erucaria hirsuta is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
